nodes.documentation:
@notice ACLGuard is a Guard implementation that checks canCall permissions against an Access Control List.
Rights to modify the ACL are managed by an internal Guard implementation.
nodes.name: ACLGuard
LogPermit
LogForbid
permit
forbid
permit
forbid
canCall
_isAuthorized
_setPermit
_setForbid

nodes.documentation:
@notice ACLGuard is a Guard implementation that checks canCall permissions against an Access Control List.
Rights to modify the ACL are managed by an internal Guard implementation.
nodes.name: ACLGuard
LogPermit
LogForbid
permit
forbid
permit
forbid
canCall
_isAuthorized
_setPermit
_setForbid

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the check is performed.
params._sig: The signature of the function which is being against.
params._src: The address that is being checked.

constructor.details: During deployment, the Guard contract must set it's own guard instance to perform auth checks against.

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the permission is revoked.
params._sig: The signature of the permission that is revoked.
params._src: The address that has permission revoked.

params._dst: Bytes32 value of the context (contract) in which the permission is revoked.
params._sig: Bytes32 value of the signature of the permission that is revoked.
params._src: Bytes32 value of the address that has permission revoked.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).details: The check performed by calling `canCall` on the Guard instance. If no Guard instance is configured, function returns false (as a failsafe).

params._sig: The function selector of the function being called.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).return: True, if the caller is authorized to make the call.

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the permission is granted.
params._sig: The signature of the permission that is granted.
params._src: The address that is granted permission.

params._dst: Bytes 32 value of the context (contract) in which the permission is granted.
params._sig: Bytes 32 value of the signature of the permission that is granted.
params._src: Bytes 32 value of the address that is granted permission.

params._guard: The address of the new Guard instance.

canCall(address,address,bytes4).notice: Returns true if `src` can call the function with signture `sig` in the `dst` contract, false otherwise.

forbid(address,address,bytes4).notice: Revokes permission from `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract. Requires authorization.

forbid(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Low level interface to revoke permission from `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract. Requires authorization.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).notice: isAuthorized will return `true` if `_src` address can call the function with the `_sig` function selector in the current context (in this contract).

permit(address,address,bytes4).notice: Grants permission to `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract. Requires authorization.

permit(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Low level interface to grants permission to `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract. Requires authorization.

setGuard(address).notice: setGuard will set the new Guard instance. The caller must have permissions to call this function in the current Guard instance.

userdoc.notice: ACLGuard is a Guard implementation that checks canCall permissions against an Access Control List. Rights to modify the ACL are managed by an internal Guard implementation.
